Reviews.Title: Exactly what we were looking for
Reviews.Author: Rick Blaine
Reviews.Content: Our box TV died, so we finally entered the flat screen market.  (Our kid's neighborhood friends can stop laughing now every time they come over.) Buying on a budget, we were looking for a 47"-55" television for around $500.00, though we were willing to spend up to $750.00.  After a day of research and shopping we settled on this TV, and we are very happy with the choice.  We paid $429.00 for the set and the picture quality is great, the television is sleek and elegant, and the stand swivels and blends in with the set just fine.  It's a perfect fit for our modestly sized family room.At first I was concerned about the 720p resolution, but after reading reviews we were assured that picture would be fine and compared to other televisions the difference would  be indistinguishable unless you were two or three feet away from the screen looking at text.  Sure enough, we have the set and the picture quality is excellent.  I prefer the plasma sets over the LED models.  To me the picture is more vibrant with the plasmas, and that is definitely the case with this LG model.This set is bare bones.  Only two HDMI ports and one USB.  But that's not a problem for us.  We are able to hook our pc to the TV and that provides most of the features that a SMART TV would provide.  (SMART TV?  Has there ever been a more funny oxymoron?) I do not find the bare bones aspect of the television to be a problem since we are minimalists.  In fact, I like how easy this television is to figure out.  The remote is very intuitive and so is the operation of its different modes.  We wanted a television that offered a big screen with outstanding picture quality for the best price possible.  I believe we found that with the LG 50PN4500.  It doesn't make coffee, it can't iron our clothes, and it won't take the angst out of my teenage daughter's life, but it does make television viewing a genuine pleasure.Our family watched Les Miserables last night, and the sound quality was very good and the picture was outstanding.  A wonderful viewing experience for the four of us.

Reviews.Title: This is a great TV
Reviews.Author: Lee
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these TVs then bought 2 more because I liked the first one so much.  I have been waiting for the quality and price to get into my price range and this TV meets both expectations.The color and picture are great.  Only plasma TVs come with 600Hz refresh rate therefore the actions shots are never blurry. Plasma TVs are difficult to find but I believe they are the best overall.  This is the 2013 model so I just presume it has updated features from previous year models.I hung these on the walls in the bedrooms with a $79 multi-position wall mount (sku 364487)from Lowes. This made the perfect combination.  A stand is included free with the TV if you want to set it on a table and save money by not buying a wall mount.

Reviews.Title: Finally
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: I was looking of a flat screen T.V. to replace an old CRT and this is the third attempt to find something that is budget friendly and quality.After following a CNET review I tried to the Samsung PN43F4500 plasma.  The picture and sound quality was great but the T.V. as a whole was unattractive and I didn't like the available settings so I took it back and tried the LG 42LN5300 LED-lit T.V.  Which was a much better looking, but, despite being 1080p resolution, the picture quality was horrible, there was noticeable motion blur and the sound quality was unacceptable.  However, I did like the available settings.  This finally led me to one of the few plasma's LG still offers and I couldn't be happier.The picture quality is awesome, and the sound is as good as you could expect with only two 10w speakers.  This is not a smart T.V. so it doesn't have all of those extra features I'd never use.  It hooks up easily to my computer via an HDMI cable and that gives all the "smart features" I need.  I can't see any pixilation with the 720p so don't let that scare you away.  The T.V. has great construction compared to the other two I tried.  This one has actual steel casing on the backside of the T.V. compared to the plastic the other LG and Samsung had.The Swivel stand is also another great feature that the other two lacked.  The quality of this T.V. just feels well above any of its competitors.  One other thing I like about this T.V. is that the on T.V. controls are located on the side of the T.V. instead of behind it, so you can actually see the buttons you are pushing.  I do use these buttons and I was rather frustrated at not being able to see the buttons I was pushing on the other T.V.'s.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Plasma TV
Reviews.Author: KD "Keli"
Reviews.Content: This is our second plasma TV.  We have a high-end plasma and now this LG 42" to replace a 15yo CRT.  The picture is excellent and compares closely to our MUCH more expensive plasma.  The swivel stand is a great feature and the menu has multiple options for the settings you prefer.  It has a shiny screen so for best viewing you should place in a room where bright light will not reflect on it.  I researched many tv's including LED & LCD and found nothing beats plasma in picture quality and price. Very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Loving my TV!!!
Reviews.Author: demetria graham
Reviews.Content: This tv is awesome! I was able to attach the stand myself and I am not the most handy lady. Set up was simple, the picture is clear and the sound is great! Great quality,great price!!

Reviews.Title: Terrific TV!
Reviews.Author: Mary M. Urbanek "marymurban"
Reviews.Content: I am enjoying this very big tv since it was delivered yesterday. So are my grandchildren while they are visiting. It was easy to set up and I like the swivel feature. The company I bought it from followed through on seeing that I got my tv in 2 days. I thank them for that.Mary

Reviews.Title: Best television for the price.
Reviews.Author: Rachel
Reviews.Content: So, I didn't even buy this tv...my 2 year old did when she got a hold of my phone and placed the order. I had every intention of returning it, but thought I would take a look and see how poor the quality was (I expected the worse for the price only being a little over $400...my phone cost more than that). From the second I turned it on I knew that I was in love. I've had this tv now for about three months and I could never even dream of returning it. The following is why:1. Great Picture. The picture on this tv is phenomenal. I always see those big flat screens at the store that are 1080p and the picture just looks weird to me. Almost life-like, to the point where it creeps me out. This tv does not bring picture quality to the point where it feels like I'm watching a play, but it does bring it to that point where I feel like I am watching a crisp movie that is vibrant in color. So, whenever my daughter insists on watching Barney's What's This Color?, she has no problems making out the colors.2. Great Sound. I've read that the thinner the tv, the more the sound quality suffers. But that isn't true with this tv, simply just because I believe that this tv is a rare breed where just about everything is perfectly made. Don't get me wrong, the speakers aren't as good as the $3000 audio set you in your car, but as far as tv's go the sound quality is through the roof. So, when my daughter wants to watch Barney's Let's Sing ABC's, she hears every single letter with clarity.3. Easy Setup. A lot of people have been complaining about this tv only having 2 HDMI ports. How many do you need? There's AV ports for things like your DVD player (who has $300 for a Blu-Ray Player?), HDMI ports for things like your Roku, video games, or even surround sound, it also has cable input for you cable tv. There are also others back there, but I have never had to use them. But what I'm saying is that when my daughter wants to watch Barney The Greatest Hits on DVD, then ten minutes later she wants to watch Barney Goes to the Zoo on Netflix, all it takes is the quick press of a button and she is on to the next thing of Barney.Sadly, I think that we may be watching just a little too much Barney. But, even though I may be a little sick of Barney, at least this tv has made it just a slightly bit more enjoyable. But I think it's time for my daughter's nap...one of the only time's I actually get to watch something for myself, so it looks like I have a date with a bag of popcorn, an episode of The Walking Dead, and a great tv to enjoy it on.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Bonnie W.
Reviews.Content: This TV is perfect for me, great picture and sound, wonderful features.  This TV is not too big and definitely exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV!
Reviews.Author: Khrys
Reviews.Content: I love this tv. I have had it for 5 months so far and it is still awesome. It has a USB port and a couple HDMI ports with the standard AVI, Component, and Coaxial. Can hook up my ipod or laptop and watch movies from the internet, or use my pc kindle app and have a 50'' book! Awesome for my myopic little eyes. I invested in a wall mount for stability because the base seems a little insecure if you get the 50'' or over. Might just be me, because I have a 7 year-old and nothing is ever secure around children, especially heavy, slightly wobbly tv's. The picture is amazing, sound is amazing, extra functions are amazing. I'm pretty sure I covered it all in the title of this review. :) In five months I can honestly say I have had no problems and have been very satisfied. This tv at retail, at Walmart, for example, is about 800$, so at this price this tv is nearly a steal. You won't be sorry you got it.

Reviews.Title: Reliable great TV
Reviews.Author: Cmodman
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for almost 3 years, and it has been great... Have it mounted up on the wall, and has never let me down. Though most HDTV shows I'm watching are in 720p, unfortunately if you're a big gamer or have a blu-ray you won't get the 1080p quality. I'm not a big videophile, so I don't notice THAT much of a difference, but I do know my Sharp 60" Aquos LED 1080p is definitely much clearer.But that's not a reason for me to give this TV any less. I was very skeptical about a plasma, but it was a great deal at my local CostCo, so couldn't pass it up. And like I said, 3 years running and it's still great, would recommend this to anyone looking to get a bigger HDTV in their home, but don't want to break the bank.

Reviews.Title: Plasma is the way to go!
Reviews.Author: Yogacat
Reviews.Content: Ordered the 42" plasma tv for the bedroom. I have a larger plasma tv in the living room and the picture on plasma tv's cannot be matched. The 42" plasma is perfect for the bedroom. This LG tv is basic without all the "smart" features, but really, who needs a "smart" tv anyway? Setup was easy and the plasma picture is gorgeous! Love it!

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: Dedee Haffner "DEETIFF2"
Reviews.Content: This tv has a absolutely great picture and I like that it doesn't weigh to much. It is a great size not to big and you can still comfortably see it without any eye strain 20 feet away. I hooked it up to my surround sound and bam.... It is easy to hook up and beautiful picture. I like that you can adjust the brightness depending on how light your room in.

Reviews.Title: Nice tv
Reviews.Author: Ronald D. Chamberlin
Reviews.Content: This is so far, a couple of months, everything we hoped for. Picture is clear, controls are versitile, easy to operate. Did need to spend some time with the manual to get familiar.

Reviews.Title: HDTV great but only optical cable for external speakers...beware!
Reviews.Author: Rev. Mark Johnson "Rev Mark Johnson"
Reviews.Content: This HDTV has great color and display qualities.  The sound is sufficent HOWEVER, if you want to attach external speakers there is only an optical outlet on the back panel and no RCA cables so it requires a special cable to order.  Otherwise the tv is fine.

Reviews.Title: For the money, this TV is hard to beat
Reviews.Author: slick "jonnybsas"
Reviews.Content: Disclaimer: I'm not a videophile.I upgraded from a 32 inch LG LED to this 50 inch plasma due to the size of the room as we had changed from a small room to a larger room.I do NOT and will NOT pay a lot of money for a TV. I'm a tightwad when it comes to electronics. I am not an early adopter of technical innovations.The TV arrived from Dell where I paid the same price as that offered on Amazon. Plus I had a $125 gift card from an earlier purchase, so the total price came in at less than $400.Even that was a little too much for a tightwad like me.As for setup, it took me longer to get the TV out of the box than it did to set it up. It was smooth and easy, just as my old LG LED had been. Hooking it up to my Roku device as simple and swift, just a matter of plugging the lines into the TV.Five stars for setup.The picture is very nice. I won't say it blew me away. It's larger of course and it does seem to be blacker than my LED.Four stars for quality of the viewing experience.The sound is just 'eh'.I'll give it three stars. I might find another way to deliver sound from the TV, a sound bar or something like that, as I like to listen to Pandora and music I have uploaded to Amazon.The upshot?Given the price, I can't see how I could give this TV anything other than five stars.I'm looking forward to having this TV for a looooooooooooooooong time.Cheers!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Michael Lasher
Reviews.Content: Not sure why this is priced so low, because it's value far exceeds the amount I spent. The biggest drawback is that I can't leave the couch now!Great blacks and colors, very easy to set up, and auto-offs so no image burn.

Reviews.Title: Great so far (1 month in)
Reviews.Author: James Bauman
Reviews.Content: As is, this product is great! However, if you refer to LG.COM and search for product # 42PN4500 you will notice a LAN connection listed. This TV, at least mine, does not have this or any type of internet connection. I have spoken with LG tech. support, and they have been very helpful with my questions. It may turn out just to be a typo on their end.Oh well, still a 5 star TV with a 5 star support team behind it. Maybe a 6 star.....we will see.

Reviews.Title: Decent TV for this price range.
Reviews.Author: Angel Villarino
Reviews.Content: Very good deal. Decent TV for a few dollars. I bought it 5 months ago and I`m very happy. No complain at all.

Reviews.Title: I love LG any product they make!
Reviews.Author: Timothy S. Akin
Reviews.Content: I love my TV! Men out there this is awesome I had an LG led TV but this plasma TV to me beats the Led the picture is crisper and the sound amazing! I love any LG product they are great and never had a problem. To the women out there who read this review your man will love this!

Reviews.Title: Great for the Money!
Reviews.Author: Alexandra Rose Davis
Reviews.Content: I wanted a 50 inch TV from a well known brand, and this was the perfect option for me. I didn't need all of the bells and whistles the other tv's come with. I bought an HDMI splitter to make up for the fact that this TV only has 2 HDMI ports. I also bought the an LG sound bar with Bluetooth wireless subwoofer. They look great together. I'd recommend this TV to anyone and you just can't beat the price!

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: Joe E
Reviews.Content: I've had this tv for a month or so. It has a great picture, nice sound if anything I wish it had more plug ins for components. But it is still a great tv

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: kingcleveland600
Reviews.Content: I love this tv, not only does it have great picture, but it even has great sound! An absolute steal for the money, A+

Reviews.Title: Fabulous Plasma HDTV SCREEN
Reviews.Author: W. View
Reviews.Content: The best of the very best. The soudn is rich. The physical appearance is beautiful. And the price? Don't look further, nobody can beat this price.

Reviews.Title: Very clear view
Reviews.Author: Dennis Blackwell
Reviews.Content: This tv is a high qualiety at a reasonable price, the life expectancy is impressive and the I was very pleased at the weight, lending it to being practical for wall hanging.

Reviews.Title: best plasma television around
Reviews.Author: Mark Jessup
Reviews.Content: I gave this 5 stars because this tv is abused by former owner by his own admission it was always on and then now it is mine and works flawless with no burn in even though we sometimes forget to turn this off.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Devils Rock
Reviews.Content: Have had this for a few months -- picture is great, no issues whatsoever.  We hung it on the wall in our basement and it looks great too!

Reviews.Title: Beautiful TV, but 50" begins to push the limits of 720p
Reviews.Author: Todd Becker
Reviews.Content: I purchased this (not from Amazon) as an upgrade to my 42" Panasonic plasma 720p.  The set and picture are beautiful, however at this size, sitting 10 feet away, there is clearly pixelation and gradiation visible, particularly in light flesh tones.  I am returning the set and replacing it with the 1080p version (50PN6500).

Reviews.Title: Enjoying my new 50" TV
Reviews.Author: Rosemary Goodman
Reviews.Content: I got my new LG Plasma HDTV a couple of weeks ago.  Delivery was quick and hassle free.The picture quality is very clear.  Just waiting to be hooked up to cable.The only thing is that I had really intended to order a smart TV but the session timed out and when I went back in I did not put all of the search criteria.  I guess I will have to order a separate device.Thanks for your service.Rosemary

Reviews.Title: OK for the price, maybe the best you can get for this price
Reviews.Author: Micheal D. Morrow "Toy lover"
Reviews.Content: There is USB and 2 HDMI inputs.  That's 3 less than I need.  They claim 1024x768 but also claim 1080p. The DirecTV box does accept the 1080p setting which it would not on the previous TV.  But, then, I am on HDMI instead of component.  So I guess it is but the divergent specs confuse me.  Audio is accepted through the HDMI connection.The picture is OK.  It took quite some time to get it set to where I liked it.  But, now, it is OK.This was a gift.  I wish I had taken the gift cert and added a few bucks for an LED TV with internet.  Could have been had for about $800 more.  And 60" instead of 50"  But, for free, it is not bad at all.  Sound is OK.  Lots of customization available.  Thank goodness.  The Brightness does almost nothing.  Same for Contrast.  But by cranking everything to the max and changing to Photo quality, it became acceptable.  Out of the box, the whites are not white and it is dark.  So the capability is there, just play with it for a while.It is linear stripes, like Sony invented.  That used to be gold.  Now it is mundane.For $500....  Just do it!

Reviews.Title: Screen not repairable
Reviews.Author: Michelle Thomas
Reviews.Content: Screen came broken,  company wouldn't return because it's larger than 47" and manufacturer thought it was broke during shipping so they wouldn't cover repair.  New screen costs as much as new tv.

Reviews.Title: horrid
Reviews.Author: Sam Lawton
Reviews.Content: this tv just shattered out of nowhere and fell on my dog, it almost broke its leg, i would definetley not reccomend buying this tv.
